scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L is a star with 0.18 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 23157.08 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L system


OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L b

OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2019-09, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 1.80 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L b is 572.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L b is 13.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L c

OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L c was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2019-09, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 0.80 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L c is 890.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L c is 13.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-2018-BLG-1011L - System With 2 Exoplanets
